definition[0]: a situation when a lot of people hurry to a place where gold has just been discovered
definition[1]: when a lot of companies or people hurry to invest in a place or activity that they expect to make them a lot of money
example[0]: The internet sparked a gold-rush for powerful desktop computers.
example[1]: Eager to take part in the gold rush, all the big Japanese trading companies have set up offices in Vietnam.
